post.summary: Create a project
post.description:
Create a project in a workspace. Please refer to the schema to see all the supported tasks and please refer to the examples to see how
the project is constructed. At the moment, Geti supports projects with a single deep learning task, or with two in a 
chain (Detection -> Classification and Detection -> Segmentation).
A few label constraints:  
- Detection projects must have at least 1 label provided.
- A default 'No object' label is automatically created for detection and segmentation tasks. 
- Classification projects require at least two labels (top-level, if hierarchical). For binary classification, please declare the negative label explicitly.
- A default 'No class' label is automatically created for classification tasks if there are no exclusive groups with 2+ labels. In practice, multilabel classification has the empty label, multiclass classification does not.
- Anomaly project must either have 2 labels provided (one being is_anomalous), or no labels provided.

hotkey.description: Key or combination of key to select this label. Can be empty (no key).

keypoint_structure.description: The keypoint structure which holds the edges of the graph, and the position of the keypoints. Supported only for Keypoint Detection tasks.

get.description: Retrieve the dataset statistics overview, this includes the number of images/videos, number of annotations, and number of objects per label.

parameters.name: dataset_id
parameters.description: The ID of the dataset in the project.

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description:
Provide the task ID to get the statistics specifically for that task. For example in a task chain project, 
if you are interested only in the statistics of the first task, you need to specify the ID of the first task. 
The task ID can be found in the response body of the [project detail](#Projects/GetProjectInfo) endpoint.

If no task id is provided, the response will contain statistics for all tasks in the project.

images.description: Number of images in the dataset

videos.description: Number of videos in the dataset

annotated_frames.description: Number of annotated video frames in the dataset

annotated_images.description: Number of annotated images in the dataset

annotated_videos.description: Number of annotated videos in the dataset

tasks.description: List with statistics for each task in the project

items.description: Statistics for the task of interest

annotated_frames.description: Number of annotated frames per task

annotated_images.description: Number of annotated images per task

annotated_videos.description: Number of annotated videos per task

objects_per_label.description: Number of annotated shapes per label

color.description: Color of the label

value.description: Number of annotated shapes for this label

object_size_distribution_per_label.description: List with information on object size distribution per label

cluster_center.description: Mean x/y values of the sizes of the objects

cluster_width_height.description: Width/height values for drawing ellipse from cluster center

color.description: Color of the label

object_distribution_from_aspect_ratio.description: Information on the distribution of aspect ratios of annotation shapes

size_distribution.description: Information on the size distribution of annotation shapes. Contains a list of width/height for every object.

items.description: Width and height of the object

aspect_ratio_threshold_tall.description: Aspect ratio threshold for classifying a shape as tall

aspect_ratio_threshold_wide.description: Aspect ratio threshold for classifying a shape as wide

post.summary: Retrieve media items with query
post.description:
Retrieves media in the dataset that fulfill the filter condition. 
The list of filter fields and their possible operators are shown below.  
If a field-operation combination is not supported then the endpoint will respond with the possible operators that are allowed for the filter.
Note that this endpoint returns images and videos. To retrieve the video frames, use the video id returned by this endpoint and pass it to the 
[video filtering](#Media/FilterVideoFrames) endpoint.

| Filter fields | Supported operations | Value |
|--------------|----------------------|-------|
|`media_upload_date`, `annotation_creation_date` | `greater`, `less` | Isodate. Example: `2024-09-26T00:00:00+02:00` |
|`media_height`, `media_width`, `shape_area_percentage`, `shape_area_pixel`, `media_size`, `video_duration`, `video_frame_rate`, `video_frame_count` | `greater`, `greater_or_equal`, `less`, `less_or_equal`, `equal`, `not_equal` | integer |
|`media_name` | `equal`, `not_equal`, `contains` | string |
|`label_id`, `shape_type`, `user_name` | `equal`, `not_equal`, `in`, `not_in` | string (id format) |
|`annotation_scene_state` | `equal`, `not_equal`, `in` | string (enum: `annotated`, `partially_annotated`, `unannotated`) |
|`media_type` | `equal`, `not_equal` | string |

parameters.name: dataset_id
parameters.description: The ID of the dataset in the project.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of items returned in the response. Default is 10 and maximum is 100.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description:
Number indicating how many items to skip from the first item that matches the query. 
This field is used in combination with the limit field for the pagination feature.

condition.description: Condition to apply to group of rules.

rules.description: All the rules to filter a dataset with.

field.description: Field to filter on in the database. Can be one of 'media_upload_date', 'media_height', 'media_width' , 'media_name', 'label_id', 'annotation_creation_date', 'annotation_scene_state', 'shape_type', 'shape_size' or 'user_name'. Note that media related filters do not affect the outcome when using the filter video endpoint as each frame will have the same values.

operator.description: Operator to filter with. Can be one of 'greater', 'less', 'greater_or_equal' , 'less_or_equal', 'equal', 'not_equal', 'in', 'not_in', 'regex'

value.description: Value that the field should match to in combination with the operator

display_url.description: Display URL of the image or video frame

height.description: Height of the image or video frame

width.description: Width of the image or video frame

size.description: Size of the image or video in bytes

extension.description: Extension of the image or video in lowercase with a dot (e.g. '.jpg')

state.description: Annotation state of the media for this task

thumbnail.description: Relative URL to the image thumbnail

type.description: Type of media. 'image' for images, 'video' for video and 'video_frame' for video frames.

upload_time.description: Upload time of the media file

roi_id.description: Optional ID of the roi id if filtering in a specific training revision

last_annotator_id.description: Optional ID of the user that last edited the annotation.

post.summary: Upload an image
post.description:
Upload an image to a dataset. Allowed formats are `.jpg`, `.jpeg`, `.bmp`, `.png`, `.tif`, `.tiff`, `.jfif`, and `.webp`. Height and
width of the images must be between 32 and 20000 pixels.   
For a classification project, the uploaded image can be annotated directly by specifying the labels in the field `upload_info`.

parameters.name: dataset_id
parameters.description: The ID of the dataset in the project.

file.description: The image file to be uploaded.

upload_info.description:
IDs of the labels to apply to the image. Uses the format of a json decodable string.
The label id's could be found from the response of the [project detail](#Projects/GetProjectInfo) endpoint. 
Example: *{\"label_ids\":[\"613776cec8223e455a88383d\", \"613776cec8223e455a88383e\"]}*.

200.description: The image has been uploaded. The 'size' field represents bits.

size.description: Size of the image or video in bytes

extension.description: Extension of the image or video in lowercase with a dot (e.g. '.jpg')

state.description: Annotation state of the media for this task

post.summary: Upload a video
post.description:
Upload a video to a dataset. Allowed formats are `.mp4`, `.avi`, `.mkv` `.mov`, `.webm` and `.m4v`. The maximum resolution for
videos is 8K and the file may not be larger than 4.7 GB. For a classification project, all frames of the uploaded
video can be annotated directly by specifying the labels in the field upload_info.

parameters.name: dataset_id
parameters.description: The ID of the dataset in the project.

file.description: The video file to be uploaded.

upload_info.description:
IDs of the labels to apply to the video. Uses the format of a json decodable string. 
The label id's could be found from the response of the [project detail](#Projects/GetProjectInfo) endpoint. 
Labels are applied to all video frames at 1 fps. 
Example: *{\"label_ids\":[\"613776cec8223e455a88383d\", \"613776cec8223e455a88383e\"]}*.

200.description: Video has been uploaded. The 'size' field represents bits, "duration" is in seconds.

display_url.description: Display URL of the image or video

frame_count.description: Number of frames in the video

height.description: Height of the video

width.description: Width of the video

size.description: Size of the video in bytes

annotation_state_per_task.description: List of per-task states obtained aggregating the annotation state with the revisit information

state.description: Annotation state of the media for this task

annotated.description: Number of annotated frames within video

partially_annotated.description: Number of partially annotated frames within video

unannotated.description: Number of unannotated frames within video

message.description: Message associated with the preprocessing operation

thumbnail.description: Relative URL to the video thumbnail

type.description: Type of media. 'image', 'video' or 'video_frame'

upload_time.description: Upload time of the video

post.summary: Retrieve specific frames from a video by applying a query on the dataset
post.description:
Retrieves video frames from a video which fulfill the filter condition. 
The list of filter fields and their possible operators are shown below.  
If a field-operation combination is not supported then the endpoint will respond with the possible operators that are allowed for the filter.

| Filter fields | Supported operations | Value |
|--------------|----------------------|-------|
|`annotation_creation_date` | `greater`, `less` | Isodate. Example: `2024-09-26T00:00:00+02:00` |
|`shape_area_percentage`, `shape_area_pixel` | `greater`, `greater_or_equal`, `less`, `less_or_equal`, `equal`, `not_equal` | integer |
|`label_id`, `shape_type`, `user_name` | `equal`, `not_equal`, `in`, `not_in` | string (id format) |
|`annotation_scene_state` | `equal`, `not_equal`, `in` | string (enum: `annotated`, `partially_annotated`, `unannotated`) |

parameters.name: dataset_id
parameters.description: The ID of the dataset in the project.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of items returned in the response. Default is 10 and maximum is 100.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description:
Number indicating how many items to skip from the first item that matches the query. 
This field is used in combination with the limit field for the pagination feature.

parameters.name: include_frame_details
parameters.description:
Set to true to include the frame details in the response. Note that this will increase the response size. 
Default is `false`.

condition.description: Condition to apply to group of rules.

rules.description: All the rules to filter a dataset with.

field.description: Field to filter on in the database. Can be one of 'media_upload_date', 'media_height', 'media_width' , 'media_name', 'label_id', 'annotation_creation_date', 'annotation_scene_state', 'shape_type', 'shape_size' or 'user_name'. Note that media related filters do not affect the outcome when using the filter video endpoint as each frame will have the same values.

operator.description: Operator to filter with. Can be one of 'greater', 'less', 'greater_or_equal' , 'less_or_equal', 'equal', 'not_equal', 'in', 'not_in', 'regex'

value.description: Value that the field should match to in combination with the operator

display_url.description: Display URL of the image or video

frame_count.description: Number of frames in the video

height.description: Height of the video

width.description: Width of the video

size.description: Size of the video in bytes

annotation_state_per_task.description: List of per-task states obtained aggregating the annotation state with the revisit information

state.description: Annotation state of the media for this task

thumbnail.description: Relative URL to the video frame thumbnail

type.description: Type of media. 'image' for images, 'video' for video and 'video_frame' for video frames.

upload_time.description: Upload time of the media file

annotation_scene_id.description: Optional ID of the annotation scene if filtering in a specific training revision

roi_id.description: Optional ID of the roi id if filtering in a specific training revision

last_annotator_id.description: Optional ID of the user that last edited the annotation.

display_url.description: Display URL of the image or video

frame_count.description: Number of frames in the video

height.description: Height of the video

width.description: Width of the video

size.description: Size of the video in bytes

next_page.description: URL to the next page of results, if the same parameters are used.

total_matched_video_frames.description: Total video frames that match the query.

post.summary: Create an annotation for an image
post.description:
Create a user annotation for an image. The user annotation scene contains multiple annotations, each of which is defined by a geometric shape and a
list of labels for that shape. The shape is defined in pixels.

parameters.name: dataset_id
parameters.description: The ID of the dataset in the project.

id.description: A UUID, used to identify an annotation.

type.description: Type of the shape.

x.description: x-coordinate of the left side of the rectangle. Coordinates are pixel values.

y.description: y-coordinate of the top of the rectangle. Coordinates are pixel values.

width.description: Width of the rectangle. Coordinates are pixel values.

height.description: Height of the rectangle. Coordinates are pixel values.

type.description: Type of the shape.

points.description: Array of points that define the polygon.

x.description: x-coordinate of the point. Coordinates are pixel values.

y.description: y-coordinate of the point. Coordinates are pixel values.

x.description: Lowest x-coordinate of the ellipse. Coordinates are pixel values.

y.description: Lowest y-coordinate of the ellipse. Coordinates are pixel values.

width.description: Width of the ellipse. Coordinates are pixel values.

height.description: Height of the ellipse. Coordinates are pixel values.

type.description: Type of the shape.

x.description: Center x-coordinate of the rotated rectangle. Coordinates are pixel values.

y.description: Center y-coordinate of the rotated rectangle. Coordinates are pixel values.

width.description: Width of the rotated rectangle (not the encapsulating box of the rectangle). Coordinates are pixel values.

height.description: Height of the rotated rectangle (not the encapsulating box of the rectangle). Coordinates are pixel values.

angle.description: Clockwise angle in degrees for the rectangle.

type.description: Type of the shape.

x.description: X-coordinate of the keypoint. Coordinates are pixel values.

y.description: Y-coordinate of the keypoint. Coordinates are pixel values.

is_visible.description: Indicates whether the feature the keypoint is describing is visible in the image.

labels_to_revisit.description: List of labels IDs for which the annotation should be revisited

items.description: A UUID, used to identify an annotation.

type.description: Type of media. 'image' for images, 'video' for videos.

labels_to_revisit_full_scene.description: List of labels IDs for which the scene (full-image ROI) should be revisited

items.description: A UUID, used to identify an annotation.

Classification (or anomaly) annotation.description:
For tasks that do not depend on the geometric shape of the annotations, such as classification or anomaly tasks, the annotations are defined 
in a specific way, depending on the project. In a single-task project, the annotations will contain a single rectangle shape covering the full image. 
While in task chain, the classification labels are attached to the geometric shape of the preceding task.

parameters.description:
This is a 0-based index, meaning to retrieve the first frame of the video, this parameter should be set to `0`. 
The possible values for this parameter range from `0` to `frame_count-1`. The `frame_count` is the total number of frames contained in the video

from the [training revision](#Training%20dataset%20versions/GetMediaForDataset) response, 
where the response includes the specific user annotation for a media that is used for training.

post.summary: Create a video annotation range
post.description:
Create a video annotation range for a video. The request body should contain the full list of 
frame ranges along with the ids of the labels associated with those ranges. Any previously submitted annotation range
for the same video is overridden by the new request; moreover, any interval of frames that is not explicitly specified 
in the request is marked as unannotated.

parameters.name: dataset_id
parameters.description: The ID of the dataset in the project.

parameters.name: skip_frame
parameters.description: Number indicating for how many frames in the video an annotation should be uploaded. A value of 1 means every frame is annotated while a value of 10 means every 10th frame gets an annotation. If nothing is passed, it defaults to the video fps.

range_labels.description: List of frame ranges and their associated labels

start_frame.description: Frame index that represents the left endpoint (inclusive) of the range

end_frame.description: Frame index that represents the right endpoint (inclusive) of the range

label_ids.description: ids of the labels to assign to the range

end_frame.description: Frame index that represents the right endpoint (inclusive) of the range

label_ids.description: ids of the labels assigned to the range

get.summary: Get the annotations from a video
get.description: Get the user annotations for the video frames in a video.

parameters.name: dataset_id
parameters.description: The ID of the dataset in the project.

parameters.name: label_only
parameters.description: Set to `true` to return the annotations without the geometric shapes. Default is `false`.

parameters.name: start_frame
parameters.description:
The starting index of the range of interest. This is a 0-based inclusive index, meaning to include the first frame of the video, 
this parameter should be set to `0`. The value cannot be bigger than `frame_count-1`. 
The `frame_count` is the total number of frames contained in the video
and it can be retrieved from the response body of [video detail](#Media/GetVideoDetail) endpoint.

parameters.name: end_frame
parameters.description: :- The ending index of the range of interest. This is a 0-based inclusive index, meaning to include the last frame of the video, this parameter should be set to `frame_count-1`; the value cannot be bigger than `frame_count-1`. The `frame_count` is the total number of frames contained in the video and it can be retrieved from the response body of [video detail](#Media/GetVideoDetail) endpoint.

parameters.name: frameskip
parameters.description:
Set to the number of desired frame intervals in the response. For example, to retrieve all frame annotations of the video, set this value to `1`. 
If not set, this value will be equal to the video fps. The video fps can be obtained from the response of the [video detail](#Media/GetVideoDetail) 
endpoint.

get.description: List the algorithms (model architectures) supported for the tasks within a project.

parameters.name: include_obsolete
parameters.description: Whether to include obsolete algorithms in the response.

task_type.description: Task type of the algorithm.

model_size.description: Storage size of the model, in MB

model_template_id.description: Unique identifier for the algorithm

gigaflops.description: Theoretical complexity of the model, in billions of operations

summary.description: A short summary that gives information about the algorithm

supports_auto_hpo.description:
Boolean that indicates whether the algorithm supports automatic hyper parameter optimization.
This field is deprecated and should not be used, it will be removed in the future.

default_algorithm.description: Boolean that indicates whether the model template is the default selection for the task

performance_category.description: The category of the model template. Some algorithms focus more on accuracy, others on inference speed.

lifecycle_stage.description:
The current support status of the model architecture. 'Active' algorithms are fully supported and maintained. 
'Deprecated' ones are still supported, but not recommended for training; in a later version, they may be
discontinued and become 'obsolete', which means that new models cannot be trained with such algorithms.

post.summary: Train a model
post.description: Submit a training job.

model_template_id.description: The ID of the model architecture to be trained. This can be obtained from the [supported algorithms endpoint](#Projects/GetSupportedAlgorithms).

task_id.description:
The ID of the task to train. For task-chain projects, this is a required parameter.
The task ID can be found in the response body of the [project detail](#Projects/GetProjectInfo) endpoint.

train_from_scratch.description: Set to `true` to train the model from scratch (i.e., not finetuning from previous version).

reshuffle_subsets.description: Set to `true` to reset the train, test and validation subsets (Only valid when `train_from_scratch` is set to `true`).

max_training_dataset_size.description: Defines the maximum dataset size for training. If no value is provided, the whole dataset is used.

enable_hyper_parameter_optimization.description:
Boolean that indicates whether to run hyper-parameter optimization (HPO) before training.
This field is deprecated and should not be used, it will be removed in the future.

hpo_parameters.description: These parameters control the automatic hyper parameter optimization process, if it is enabled. If `enable_hyper_parameter_optimization` is set to `true`, the hpo_parameters in this field must be specified. Otherwise, this field can be left empty.

hpo_time_ratio.description: This parameter controls the time allotted for automatic hyper parameter optimization. It is measured in multiples of training time, e.g. setting `hpo_time_ratio` to `4.0` will result in the hpo process taking approximately 4 times as long as a normal training without hpo would.

hyper_parameters.description: Hyper parameters for the model to be trained

components.description: Array of hyper parameter groups

items.title: Hyper parameter group
items.description: The new values for the parameters in the hyper parameter group to set

group_name.description: The name of the hyper parameter group

type.description: Describes the type of the component. For hyper parameter groups, type is always set to HYPER_PARAMETER_GROUP

value.description: Value to set the parameter to.

name.description: Name to identify the parameter by in the system.

value.description: Value to set the parameter to.

get.summary: Get information on all models and their groups belonging to a project
get.description:
Get information on all model groups in a project. Each model group represents one model architecture that has been trained in the project and
contains a list of successfully trained models of that architecture. 
To obtain more detail on each of the model version, please use the [model detail](#Models/GetModelDetail) endpoint.

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description:
Provide the task ID to get the model groups related to that task. For example in a task chain project, 
set this parameter to the ID of the first task if you are interested only in the model groups of the first task. 
The task ID can be found in the response body of the [project detail](#Projects/GetProjectInfo) endpoint.

If no task id is provided, the response will contain the model groups for all tasks in the project.

200.description: Information on all models and their groups belonging to a project

size.description: Model size in bytes.

total_disk_size.description:
The aggregated size (bytes) for model-related files. This includes all the exportable binaries, such as exportable code, 
and the binaries from the optimized models.

score.description: Accuracy score for the model. Only applicable for non-anomaly projects.

label_schema_in_sync.description: Boolean that indicates whether the label schema for the model is in sync with the latest label schema for the task containing the model

score_up_to_date.description:
Boolean indicating whether the score of the model is the most recent score.
This parameter is deprecated and should not be used, it will be removed in the future.

active_model.description: Boolean indicating that the model is used for inference requests for the project.

purge_info.description:
Purging state of the model. A model is purged when all its binary files are removed from the server. 
This is performed through the [purge model](#Models/ArchiveModel) endpoint.

is_purged.description: Boolean indicating if the model is purged.

user_uid.description: The user ID who requested the cancellation.

purge_time.description: The time when the model was purged.

lifecycle_stage.description:
The current support status of the model format. 'Active' models are fully supported and maintained. 
'Obsolete' ones can be used for inference and deployment, but they can no longer be optimized.
In addition, training with an 'obsolete' happens from scratch rather than incrementally.

name.description: Name of the model group, typically the name of the architecture.

model_template_id.description: The ID of the model architecture.

learning_approach.description:
The learning approach from which the model is generated. 

`fully_supervised` is for models that are trained through training job; while `one_shot` models are not. For example, `one_shot` 
is used for visual prompt models.

lifecycle_stage.description:
The current support status of the model architecture. 'Active' algorithms are fully supported and maintained. 
'Deprecated' ones are still supported, but not recommended for training; in a later version, they may be
discontinued and become 'obsolete', which means that new models cannot be trained with such algorithms.

get.summary: Get detailed information on a model
get.description:
Get detailed information on a model. The response contains the base model version as well as the list of 
optimized models (OpenVINO and ONNX) that are generated from the base model.

parameters.name: model_group_id
parameters.description: The ID of the model group of interest. This can be found as `model_groups[].id` in the response body of [model group listing](#Models/GetModelGroups) endpoint.

parameters.name: model_id
parameters.description:
The ID of the model of interest. This can be found as `model_groups[].models[].id` from the response of [model group listing](#Models/GetModelGroups) 
endpoint or `models[].id` from [model group detail](#Models/GetModelGroup) endpoint.

size.description: Model size in bytes

total_disk_size.description:
The aggregated size (bytes) for model-related files. This includes all the exportable binaries, such as exportable code, 
and the binaries from the optimized models.

score.description: Accuracy score for the model. Only applicable for non-anomaly projects.

label_schema_in_sync.description: Boolean that indicates whether the label schema for the model is in sync with the latest label schema for the task containing the model

score_up_to_date.description:
Boolean that indicates whether the score of the model is the most recent score.
This parameter is deprecated and should not be used, it will be removed in the future.

fps_throughput.description:
FPS throughput for the model.
This parameter is deprecated and should not be used, it will be removed in the future.

latency.description:
Latency for the model, in ms.
This parameter is deprecated and should not be used, it will be removed in the future.

target_device.description:
Type of device the model is best used on.
This parameter is deprecated and should not be used, it will be removed in the future.

target_device_type.description:
Detailed type of device the model is best used on.
This parameter is deprecated and should not be used, it will be removed in the future.

previous_trained_revision_id.description: ID of the previous trained model

lifecycle_stage.description:
The current support status of the model format. 'Active' models are fully supported and maintained. 
'Obsolete' ones can be used for inference and deployment, but they can no longer be optimized.
In addition, training with an 'obsolete' happens from scratch rather than incrementally.

color.description: Label color, picked at random if not specified

is_empty.description: Indicates whether the label is an empty label

is_anomalous.description: Indicates whether the label is anomalous or not

is_deleted.description: Indicates whether the label is deleted

hotkey.description: Key or combination of key to select this label. Can be empty (no key).

n_samples.description:
The number of items in the training dataset. Note that for the second task in a task chain, this could be more than 
`n_images + n_frames` because each bounding box of the first task corresponds to one dataset item of the second task.

n_images.description: The number of distinct images in the dataset

n_frames.description: The number of distinct video frames in the dataset

training_framework.description: Information about the framework used to train the model

type.description: Type of the training framework

purge_info.description:
Purging state of the model. A model is purged when all its binary files are removed from the server. 
This is performed through the [purge model](#Models/ArchiveModel) endpoint.

is_purged.description: Boolean indicating if the model is purged.

user_uid.description: The user ID who requested the cancellation.

purge_time.description: The time when the model was purged.

learning_approach.description:
The learning approach from which the model is generated. 

`fully_supervised` is for models that are trained through training job; while `one_shot` models are not. For example, `one_shot` 
is used for visual prompt models.

get.description:
Get statistics for a model. The statistics includes training and evaluation statistics.  
The response will be a list of charts; each chart will be one of the following types: `text`, `bar`, `radial_bar`, `line` or `matrix`. For each type of chart, the response body has a different
format. See the schemas for information on the format of the response.

parameters.name: model_group_id
parameters.description: The ID of the model group of interest. This can be found as `model_groups[].id` in the response body of [model group listing](#Models/GetModelGroups) endpoint.

parameters.name: model_id
parameters.description:
The ID of the model of interest. This can be found as `model_groups[].models[].id` from the response of [model group listing](#Models/GetModelGroups) 
endpoint or `models[].id` from [model group detail](#Models/GetModelGroup) endpoint.

header.description: Header describing the chart

type.description: Type of chart. Current implementation allows 'line', 'text', 'bar', 'radial_bar' and 'matrix'.

oneOf.description: Text chart, containing string or number to display
Bar (also for radial bar) chart, depicted by an array containing values describing the bars in the chart.

items.description: Data for each bar in the chart

header.description: Name of the bar

value.description: Value for the bar

color.description: Color of the bar in hex format

oneOf.description: Line chart, containing description of the chart and the lines coordinates.

x_axis_label.description: Label of the x-axis for the line chart

y_axis_label.description: Label of the y-axis for the line chart

color.description: Color of the bar in hex format

line_data.description: Array of line data, each containing the information for one line.

points.description: List of coordinates of the points in the line chart

x.description: X coordinate of the point

y.description: Y coordinate of the point

oneOf.description: Matrix chart, containing multiple matrices. Typically used for confusion matrices in classification projects.

row_header.description: The header for all the rows in the matrix

column_header.description: The header for all the columns in the matrix

row_names.description: Array containing the names of the matrix rows

column_names.description: Array containing the names of the matrix columns

post.summary: Archive a model
post.description:
Archive a model. This will permanently delete all the binary files related to the model including base model 
weights, optimized model weights and exportable code. This endpoint can only be called on base models, not optimized 
models. Additionally, the model must not be the latest in a model group or be the active model.

The ID of the model of interest. This can be found as `model_groups[].models[].id` from the response of [model group listing](#Models/GetModelGroups) 
endpoint or `models[].id` from [model group detail](#Models/GetModelGroup) endpoint.

post.summary: Generate or retrieve a prediction for an image or video frame
post.description: Generate or retrieve a prediction for an image or a single video frame.

parameters.name: pipeline_id
parameters.description:
Set this parameter to `active` request predictions generated using the currently active model(s) in the project.
For task chain, this parameter could be set to the task ID within the project to request for inference only for that task. 
The task ID can be found in the [project detail](#Projects/GetProjectInfo) endpoint.

parameters.name: roi
parameters.description:
The Region of Interest (ROI) of the image or video frame to use for inference.
The ROI is a rectangle defined by four zero-index pixel coordinates, separated by comma,
with the format: `left,top,width,height`.

parameters.name: use_cache
parameters.description:
This parameter defines the origin of the predictions.  

When `use_cache=always`, the predictions are pulled from the database cache. If no prediction with the desired configuration exists in the
cache, a 'not found' respones will be returned. 

When `use_cache=never`, the predictions are generated on the fly based on the request. Note that, the predictions are generated using
the OpenVINO model with FP32 precision with XAI. This model can be found under the [model detail](#Models/GetModelDetail) endpoint.  

When `use_cache=auto`, the system will first attempt to retrieve an existing prediction for the media item from the
cache. If no prediction with the desired configuration exists in the cache, a new prediction will be generated on the
fly. By default, `auto` is used.

requestBody.description: Either an image file, or an identifier for an image or single video frame for which a prediction should be returned.

file.description: The image file to be uploaded for inference.

oneOf.description: Identifier for an image which already exists on the system.
Identifier for a single video frame.

frame_index.description:
This is a 0-based index, meaning to retrieve the first frame of the video, this parameter should be set to `0`. 
The possible values for this parameter range from `0` to `frame_count-1`. The `frame_count` is the total number of frames contained in the video
and it can be retrieved from the response body of [video detail](#Media/GetVideoDetail) endpoint.

type.description: Type of the shape.

x.description: x-coordinate of the left side of the rectangle. Coordinates are pixel values.

y.description: y-coordinate of the top of the rectangle. Coordinates are pixel values.

width.description: Width of the rectangle. Coordinates are pixel values.

height.description: Height of the rectangle. Coordinates are pixel values.

type.description: Type of the shape.

points.description: Array of points that define the polygon.

x.description: x-coordinate of the point. Coordinates are pixel values.

y.description: y-coordinate of the point. Coordinates are pixel values.

type.description: Type of the shape.

x.description: Lowest x-coordinate of the ellipse. Coordinates are pixel values.

y.description: Lowest y-coordinate of the ellipse. Coordinates are pixel values.

width.description: Width of the ellipse. Coordinates are pixel values.

height.description: Height of the ellipse. Coordinates are pixel values.

type.description: Type of the shape.

x.description: Center x-coordinate of the rotated rectangle. Coordinates are pixel values.

y.description: Center y-coordinate of the rotated rectangle. Coordinates are pixel values.

width.description: Width of the rotated rectangle (not the encapsulating box of the rectangle). Coordinates are pixel values.

height.description: Height of the rotated rectangle (not the encapsulating box of the rectangle). Coordinates are pixel values.

angle.description: Clockwise angle in degrees for the rectangle.

type.description: Type of the shape.

x.description: X-coordinate of the keypoint. Coordinates are pixel values.

y.description: Y-coordinate of the keypoint. Coordinates are pixel values.

is_visible.description: Indicates whether the feature the keypoint is describing is visible in the image.

probability.title: Probability
probability.description: Estimated probability of a prediction. For annotations, this is set to 1.

media_identifier.description: Optional identifier for the media item on which the prediction was made. Only included for persistent media.

204.description: No prediction available for the requested media.

highlighting the area which the model finds to be salient. For more info, please refer to [OpenVINO XAI](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino_xai).

get.summary: Get statistics for a training revision
get.description: Retrieves the training revision statistics overview. A training revision is a specific dataset that has been split into the three Deep Learning subsets; Train, Test, and Validation. The "subset_info" retrieves the split of images and frames (aggregated together from the dataset) among the Train, Test, and Validation subsets. The "dataset_info" retrieves the distribution of images, videos, and frames within the whole dataset.

post.summary: Retrieve specific media items by applying a query on the training revision
post.description: Allows the user to quickly filter through their training revision by supplying one or more filters to match media items against. Currently you can filter on 'media_upload_date', 'media_height', 'media_width' , 'media_name', 'label_id',  'annotation_scene_state', 'annotation_creation_date', 'shape_type', 'shape_area_percentage', 'shape_area_pixel', 'subset' and 'user_name'. The following operators can be used 'greater', 'less', 'greater_or_equal', 'less_or_equal', 'equal',  'not_equal', 'in' and 'not_in'. Not all combinations of filter and operator can be used. If a combination is not  supported then the endpoint will respond with the possible operators that are allowed for the filter.

Number indicating how many items to skip from the first item that matches the query. 
This field is used in combination with the limit field for the pagination feature.

condition.description: Condition to apply to group of rules.

rules.description: All the rules to filter a dataset with.

field.description: Field to filter on in the database. Can be one of 'media_upload_date', 'media_height', 'media_width' , 'media_name', 'label_id', 'annotation_creation_date', 'annotation_scene_state', 'shape_type', 'shape_size' or 'user_name'. Note that media related filters do not affect the outcome when using the filter video endpoint as each frame will have the same values.

operator.description: Operator to filter with. Can be one of 'greater', 'less', 'greater_or_equal' , 'less_or_equal', 'equal', 'not_equal', 'in', 'not_in', 'regex'

value.description: Value that the field should match to in combination with the operator

post.description: Allows the user to quickly filter through their test results by supplying one or more filters to match results against. Currently you can filter on 'score' and 'label_id' fields. The following operators can be used for score 'greater', 'less', 'greater_or_equal', 'less_or_equal'. The following operator can be used for label id 'equal'. If a non-allowed filter is used, then the endpoint will respond with the possible operators that are allowed.

parameters.name: test_id

parameters.name: limit

parameters.name: skip

Number indicating how many items to skip from the first item that matches the query. 
This field is used in combination with the limit field for the pagination feature.

parameters.description: Field to sort by, only 'score' available

state.description: Overall state obtained aggregating the annotation states with the 'revisit' information on a per-task basis. This only has meaning for an  image/frame/scene, as a video does not have an annotation scene. - Image/VideoFrame/AnnotationScene: - to_revisit: Some annotations need to be revisited by the user for this task - annotated: All the ROIs for this task are annotated (contain a label for the task) - partially_annotated: Some ROIs for this task do not contain labels, other ones do - none: No label is present for this task - Video: - all tasks are set to null

annotation_state_per_task.description: Annotation state per task of the image.

state.description: Overall state obtained aggregating the annotation states with the 'revisit' information on a per-task basis. This only has meaning for an  image/frame/scene, as a video does not have an annotation scene. - Image/VideoFrame/AnnotationScene: - to_revisit: Some annotations need to be revisited by the user for this task - annotated: All the ROIs for this task are annotated (contain a label for the task) - partially_annotated: Some ROIs for this task do not contain labels, other ones do - none: No label is present for this task - Video: - all tasks are set to null

frame_index.description: The index of the video frame (0-based)

display_url.description: Display URL of the image or video frame

height.description: Height of the image or video frame

width.description: Width of the image or video frame

size.description: Size of the image or video in bytes

extension.description: Extension of the image or video in lowercase with a dot (e.g. '.jpg')

name.description: The title of the video frame

oneOf.description: A UUID, used to identify an annotation.

name.description: The name of the metric of this score

value.description: The score in percentage (0-100)

thumbnail.description: Relative URL to the video frame thumbnail

type.description: Type of media. 'image' for images, 'video' for video and 'video_frame' for video frames.

upload_time.description: Upload time of the media file

uploader_id.description: The ID of the user who uploaded the video

next_page.description: URL to the next page of results, if the same parameters are used.

total_matched_images.description: Total images that match the query.

total_matched_videos.description: Total videos that match the query.

total_matched_video_frames.description: Total video frames that match the query.

get.description: Get info on all jobs, running and completed.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Select only items related to the given project.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Select only jobs in the given state.

parameters.name: job_type
parameters.description: Select only jobs of the given type.

parameters.name: author_id
parameters.description: Filter jobs by the author's unique identifier

parameters.name: start_time_from
parameters.description: Filter jobs which started after this time. If time is not specified (only date), it defaults to the beginning of the day.

parameters.name: start_time_to
parameters.description: Filter jobs which started before this time. If time is not specified (only date), it defaults to the beginning of the day.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description:
Number indicating how many items to skip from the first item that matches the query. 
This field is used in combination with the limit field for the pagination feature.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of items returned in the response. Default is 10 and maximum is 100.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Field to sort by, could be [job_name, start_time, end_time, creation_date, priority]

get.summary: Get the current configuration for all components in the project.
get.description: This endpoint gets the configuration for all components in the project, as well as the current algorithms used in the task chain. The configuration is subdivided into components. Examples of configuration components are the deep learning parameters, postprocessing parameters or subset-related parameters. Some components are further divided into parameter groups.

global.description: Array of configurable parameter objects for the different global (i.e. project-wide) components in the project

type.description: Type of the configurable parameters. For component parameters the type is always 'CONFIGURABLE_PARAMETERS'.

component.description: Describes the component to which the configurable parameters apply

type.description: Describes the type of the configuration. Set to COMPONENT_PARAMETERS for a configuration that relates to a component.
Describes the type of the configurable parameters. For hyper parameters, type is set to HYPER_PARAMETERS.

group_name.description: Name of the hyper parameter group

type.description: Describes the type of the component. For hyper parameter groups, type is always set to HYPER_PARAMETER_GROUP

header.description: Name of the configuration

description.description: Description of the configuration, indicating which part of the system it controls.
description.example: These parameters control the splitting of the dataset into training, validation and test set.

header.description: Defines the parameter group

description.description: Description of the parameter group

header.description: User friendly title for the parameter.

description.description: User friendly description for what the parameter does.

warning.description: Warning message (if any) that explains the user to use caution when changing this parameter, and why.

value.description: Value that this parameter currently takes.

default_value.description: Default value that should be set for this parameter.

name.description: Name to identify the parameter by in the system.

template_type.description: Describes the template type of the parameter. 'selectable' is used for parameters with a fixed set of possible values. 'input' is used for parameters that allow free input, possibly restricted to a certain range.

data_type.description: Describes the type of parameter. Parameters can be integers, floats, boolean or string.

options.description: List of values that this parameter can take. Only used for selectable string and selectable float parameters

min_value.description: Minimum value that can be set for this parameter. Only used for numeric parameters.

max_value.description: Minimum value that can be set for this parameter. Only used for numeric parameters.

header.description: User friendly title for the configurable boolean.

description.description: User friendly description for what the boolean does.

warning.description: Warning message (if any) that explains the user to use caution when changing this parameter, and why.

default_value.description: Default value that should be set for this boolean.

name.description: Name to identify the configurable boolean by in the system.

template_type.description: Describes the template type of the parameter. 'selectable' is used for parameters with a fixed set of possible values. 'input' is used for parameters that allow free input, possibly restricted to a certain range. Template_type is always 'input' for a configurable boolean.

data_type.description: Describes the type of parameter. Parameters can be integers, floats, boolean or string. Data_type is always 'boolean' for a configurable boolean.

task_title.description: Title of the task the configuration is connected to

global.description: Specify the project-level configuration for active learning.

parameters.description: Function to aggregate the active scores of a media across the tasks
parameters.name: inter_task_reduce_fn

parameters.description: Number of images analysed after training for active learning
parameters.header: Number of images analysed after training for active learning
parameters.name: max_unseen_media

global.description: Specify parameters to control how datasets are managed in the system.

parameters.description: Enabling NDR will help to prevent annotating very similar images. Note that this does not remove any data from the project,it is only used in selecting images for active learning.
parameters.header: Use Near Duplicate Removal (NDR) for active learning
parameters.name: use_ndr

components.description: Learning Parameters
components.name: learning_parameters

parameters.description: The number of training samples seen in each iteration of training. Increasing this value improves training time and may make the training more stable. A larger batch size has higher memory requirements.
parameters.name: batch_size
parameters.warning: Increasing this value may cause the system to use more memory than available, potentially causing out of memory errors, please update with caution.

parameters.description: Learning rate parameter value will be ignored if enabled.
parameters.name: enable_lr_finder

parameters.description: Increasing this value will speed up training convergence but might make it unstable.
parameters.name: learning_rate

parameters.description: Increasing this value causes the results to be more robust but training time will be longer.
parameters.name: max_num_epochs

components.description: Specify the distribution of annotated samples over the training, validation and test sets.

groups.description: Specify the distributions of annotated samples over training, validation and test set.
groups.name: subset_parameters

parameters.description: Fraction of annotated data that will be assigned to the test set
parameters.name: test_proportion

parameters.description: Fraction of annotated data that will be assigned to the training set
parameters.name: train_proportion

parameters.description: Fraction of annotated data that will be assigned to the validation set
parameters.name: validation_proportion

parameters.description: If this setting is enabled, the system will automatically determine the most optimal distribution of the annotated samples over training, validation and test set. Disable this setting to manually specify the proportions.
parameters.name: auto_subset_fractions

components.description: Specify the number of required annotations for a task

parameters.description: If this is ON, the first training will only be triggered when each label is present in N images, while N is number of required images for the first training. Otherwise, first training will be triggered when N images have been annotated. If first training has been triggered, this parameter will not take effect.
parameters.header: Label constraint for the first training
parameters.name: label_constraint_first_training

parameters.description: The minimum number of new annotations required before auto-train is triggered. Auto-training will start every time that this number of annotations is created.
parameters.header: Number of images required for auto-training
parameters.name: required_images_auto_training

parameters.description: Only applicable if auto-training is on. Set this parameter on to let the system dynamically compute the number of required annotations between training rounds based on model performance and training dataset size.
parameters.name: use_dynamic_required_annotations

components.description: Specify the task-level configuration for active learning.

parameters.description: The feature vector score extractor outputs scores which reflect the distances between the known and unknown samples in the latent space.
parameters.name: feature_vector_extractor

parameters.description: The uncertainty score extractor outputs scores which reflect the uncertainty of the predictions on the respective media
parameters.name: uncertainty_extractor

parameters.description: Function to aggregate the active scores of a media within a task
parameters.name: intra_task_reduce_fn

components.description: General settings for a task.

parameters.description: Enable to allow the task to start training automatically when it is ready to train.
parameters.name: auto_training

task_title.description: Title of the task the configuration is connected to

components.description: Learning Parameters
components.name: learning_parameters

parameters.description: The number of training samples seen in each iteration of training. Increasing this value improves training time and may make the training more stable. A larger batch size has higher memory requirements.
parameters.name: batch_size
parameters.warning: Increasing this value may cause the system to use more memory than available, potentially causing out of memory errors, please update with caution.

parameters.description: Learning rate parameter value will be ignored if enabled.
parameters.name: enable_lr_finder

parameters.description: Increasing this value will speed up training convergence but might make it unstable.
parameters.name: learning_rate

parameters.description: Increasing this value causes the results to be more robust but training time will be longer.
parameters.name: max_num_epochs

components.description: Specify the distribution of annotated samples over the training, validation and test sets.

groups.description: Specify the distributions of annotated samples over training, validation and test set.
groups.name: subset_parameters

parameters.description: Fraction of annotated data that will be assigned to the test set
parameters.name: test_proportion

parameters.description: Fraction of annotated data that will be assigned to the training set
parameters.name: train_proportion

parameters.description: Fraction of annotated data that will be assigned to the validation set
parameters.name: validation_proportion

parameters.description: If this setting is enabled, the system will automatically determine the most optimal distribution of the annotated samples over training, validation and test set. Disable this setting to manually specify the proportions.
parameters.name: auto_subset_fractions

components.description: Specify the number of required annotations for a task

parameters.description: If this is ON, the first training will only be triggered when each label is present in N images, while N is number of required images for the first training. Otherwise, first training will be triggered when N images have been annotated. If first training has been triggered, this parameter will not take effect.
parameters.header: Label constraint for the first training
parameters.name: label_constraint_first_training

parameters.description: The minimum number of new annotations required before auto-train is triggered. Auto-training will start every time that this number of annotations is created.
parameters.header: Number of images required for auto-training
parameters.name: required_images_auto_training

parameters.description: Only applicable if auto-training is on. Set this parameter on to let the system dynamically compute the number of required annotations between training rounds based on model performance and training dataset size.
parameters.name: use_dynamic_required_annotations

components.description: Specify the task-level configuration for active learning.

parameters.description: The feature vector score extractor outputs scores which reflect the distances between the known and unknown samples in the latent space.
parameters.name: feature_vector_extractor

parameters.description: The uncertainty score extractor outputs scores which reflect the uncertainty of the predictions on the respective media
parameters.name: uncertainty_extractor

parameters.description: Function to aggregate the active scores of a media within a task
parameters.name: intra_task_reduce_fn

components.description: General settings for a task.

parameters.description: Enable to allow the task to start training automatically when it is ready to train.
parameters.name: auto_training

post.summary: Upload a dataset archive
post.description:
Upload a dataset archive to the server.

This endpoint allows clients to upload a dataset archive directly to the server without using the TUS protocol.

file.title: File
file.description: The dataset file to be uploaded.

value.message: Could not upload a file with a size of 0 bytes.
Request too large: exceeding 10240 MB is not allowed.

post.summary: Start uploading a dataset archive using TUS
post.description:
Initiate a new TUS session to upload a dataset archive.

This endpoint creates a new upload resource on the server according to the TUS protocol (https://tus.io/protocols/resumable-upload.html).
The client provides metadata such as file size and name in the request headers, and the server responds with a location URL for the newly created resource.
This URL is used for subsequent upload operations (e.g., PATCH, HEAD).

parameters.name: tus-resumable
parameters.description: version of TUS used by the client

parameters.name: upload-length
parameters.description: size in bytes of the file to be created

head.summary: Get the status of a dataset archive TUS upload
head.description:
Retrieve the current status of the TUS upload of a dataset archive.

This endpoint provides information such as the current offset of uploaded data through the `Upload-Offset` header,
allowing the client to resume uploads from the correct position.
It is useful for verifying progress or ensuring consistency before appending further data.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description:
The ID of the file uploaded using the TUS protocol.
This can be found in the `Location` response header of [TUS upload initialization](#Project%20Import%2FExport/CreateTUSUpload).

parameters.name: tus-resumable
parameters.description: version of TUS used by the client

upload-length.description: total size in bytes of the file

upload-offset.description: size in bytes of data uploaded so far

patch.summary: Append data to a running TUS upload of a dataset archive
patch.description:
Upload a chunk of the dataset archive data to the server, appending it to the TUS upload at the specified offset.

This endpoint allows the client to resume uploading data with TUS by sending the remaining data from the last known offset.
It is recommended to choose a large chunk size (based on server limitations) to speed up the overall upload operation.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description:
The ID of the file uploaded using the TUS protocol.
This can be found in the `Location` response header of [TUS upload initialization](#Project%20Import%2FExport/CreateTUSUpload).

parameters.name: tus-resumable
parameters.description: version of TUS used by the client

parameters.name: upload-offset
parameters.description: size in bytes of data uploaded so far

It is useful for cleaning up incomplete uploads.

post.summary: Prepare a dataset to be imported as a new project
post.description:
Analyze an uploaded dataset archive file and prepare it to be imported as a new project.

This endpoint submits a job to prepare the dataset for import. Specifically, the job scans the dataset 
to determine the compatible task types and to identify potential issues in the data.
The status of this operation can be monitored in real-time through the [job status endpoint](#Jobs/GetJob);
once the job is finished, the list of compatible task types, labels and warnings can be found in the job metadata.

post.summary: Create a new project from a prepared dataset
post.description:
Finalize the creation of a new project from an imported dataset, that has been previously uploaded and prepared.

This endpoint submits a job to create a new project with a given project name, task type and labels, that will also
contain all the media and annotations from the imported dataset.
The status of this operation can be monitored in real-time through the [job status endpoint](#Jobs/GetJob);
once the job is finished, the id of the created project can be found in the job metadata.

post.summary: Prepare a dataset to be imported into an already existing project
post.description:
Analyze an uploaded dataset archive file and prepare it to be imported into an existing project.

This endpoint submits a job to prepare the dataset for import. Specifically, the job scans the dataset
to assess the compatibility with the target project and to identify potential issues in the data.
The status of this operation can be monitored in real-time through the [job status endpoint](#Jobs/GetJob);
once the job is finished, the list of parsed labels and warnings can be found in the job metadata.

post.summary: Import a prepared dataset into an existing project
post.description:
Finalize the import of an already prepared dataset into an existing project.

This endpoint submits a job to import the dataset, including all its media and annotations from the imported dataset.
The status of this operation can be monitored in real-time through the [job status endpoint](#Jobs/GetJob);
once the job is finished, the id of the created project can be found in the job metadata.

Within the project, the data may be imported into an existing dataset or a new dataset, depending on the request body:
- If one specifies a `dataset_id`, then the target will be that dataset
- If one specifies a `dataset_name`, then a new dataset will be created with that name

The `labels_map` allows the user to map the labels found in the prepared dataset to the labels of the target project.

oneOf.title: Import to project - existing dataset body

labels_map.title: Map of dataset label names to project label ids

post.summary: Export a dataset as an archive
post.description:
Export a dataset as a zip archive file, including all the media and the respective annotations.

This endpoint submits a job to export the dataset.
The status of the export operation can be monitored in real-time through the [job status endpoint](#Jobs/GetJob);
after it completes, the URL to download the exported zip archive can be found in the job metadata.

The downloaded dataset archive can be later imported as a new project, or merged into an existing dataset of compatible type.

parameters.name: dataset_id
parameters.description: The ID of the dataset in the project.

parameters.name: export_format
parameters.description: The format to which to export the dataset

parameters.name: include_unannotated_media
parameters.description: Boolean that indicates if unannotated media should be included in the export dataset.

parameters.name: save_video_as_images
parameters.description: If true, videos will be exported as a set of images, one for each annotated frame. If the specified dataset format cannot natively represent videos (e.g., VOC, COCO, ...), this parameter is overridden to true by the server. Conversely, if the format is Datumaro and this option is false, videos will be exported fully.

post.summary: Start uploading a project archive using TUS
post.description:
Initiate a new TUS session to upload a project archive.

This endpoint creates a new upload resource on the server according to the TUS protocol (https://tus.io/protocols/resumable-upload.html).
The client provides metadata such as file size and name in the request headers, and the server responds with a location URL for the newly created resource.
This URL is used for subsequent upload operations (e.g., PATCH, HEAD).

parameters.name: tus-resumable
parameters.description: version of TUS used by the client

parameters.name: upload-length
parameters.description: size in bytes of the file to upload

head.summary: Get the status of a project archive TUS upload
head.description:
Retrieve the current status of the TUS upload of a project archive.

This endpoint provides information such as the current offset of uploaded data through the `Upload-Offset` header,
allowing the client to resume uploads from the correct position.
It is useful for verifying progress or ensuring consistency before appending further data.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description:
The ID of the file uploaded using the TUS protocol.
This can be found in the `Location` response header of [TUS upload initialization](#Project%20Import%2FExport/CreateTUSUpload).

parameters.description: version of TUS used by the client

upload-length.description: total size in bytes of the file

upload-offset.description: size in bytes of data uploaded so far

patch.summary: Append data to a running TUS upload of a project archive
patch.description:
Upload a chunk of the project archive data to the server, appending it to the TUS upload at the specified offset.

This endpoint allows the client to resume uploading data with TUS by sending the remaining data from the last known offset.
It is recommended to choose a large chunk size (based on server limitations) to speed up the overall upload operation.

post.summary: Prepare code deployment for project
post.description:
This endpoint triggers preparation for code deployment for a specific project. For single-task projects (Detection, Segmentation, etc), it will export the only model used. For task-chain projects, it will export all the models. Only models in OpenVINO IR format are supported.
This endpoint is deprecated. Use the [deployment package endpoint](../deployment_package/download_deployment_package_endpoint.yaml) to prepare and download code deployment.

get.description:
Not available on on-premises environments.

The running credit balance of an organization is calculated during the current subscription cycle, and consists of 3 values:
1) incoming - credits, allocated to the organization at the start of the subscription cycle;
2) blocked - credits, temporary reserved for the training or optimization jobs in progress;
3) available - credits, which are available for usage.

parameters.description: Optional parameter. If not provided, the current credits balance is returned.

field.description: Field to filter on in the database. Can be one of 'media_upload_date', 'media_height', 'media_width' , 'media_name', 'label_id', 'annotation_creation_date', 'annotation_scene_state', 'shape_type', 'shape_size' or 'user_name'. Note that media related filters do not affect the outcome when using the filter video endpoint as each frame will have the same values.

operator.description: Operator to filter with. Can be one of 'greater', 'less', 'greater_or_equal' , 'less_or_equal', 'equal', 'not_equal', 'in', 'not_in', 'regex'

value.description: Value that the field should match to in combination with the operator

condition.description: Condition to apply to group of rules.

rules.description: All the rules to filter a dataset with.

This only has meaning for an  image/frame/scene, as a video does not have an annotation scene. - Image/VideoFrame/AnnotationScene: - to_revisit: Some annotations need to be revisited by the user for this task - annotated: All the ROIs for this task are annotated (contain a label for the task) - partially_annotated: Some ROIs for this task do not contain labels, other ones do - none: No label is present for this task - Video: - all tasks are set to null

model_template_lifecycle_stage.description:
The current support status of the model architecture. 'Active' algorithms are fully supported and maintained. 
'Deprecated' ones are still supported, but not recommended for training; in a later version, they may be
discontinued and become 'obsolete', which means that new models cannot be trained with such algorithms.

task_type.description: Task type of the algorithm.

model_size.description: Storage size of the model, in MB

model_template_id.description: Unique identifier for the algorithm

gigaflops.description: Theoretical complexity of the model, in billions of operations

summary.description: A short summary that gives information about the algorithm

supports_auto_hpo.description:
Boolean that indicates whether the algorithm supports automatic hyper parameter optimization.
This field is deprecated and should not be used, it will be removed in the future.

default_algorithm.description: Boolean that indicates whether the model template is the default selection for the task

performance_category.description: The category of the model template. Some algorithms focus more on accuracy, others on inference speed.

model_template_id.description: The ID of the model architecture to be trained. This can be obtained from the [supported algorithms endpoint](#Projects/GetSupportedAlgorithms).

task_id.description:
The ID of the task to train. For task-chain projects, this is a required parameter.
The task ID can be found in the response body of the [project detail](#Projects/GetProjectInfo) endpoint.

train_from_scratch.description: Set to `true` to train the model from scratch (i.e., not finetuning from previous version).

reshuffle_subsets.description: Set to `true` to reset the train, test and validation subsets (Only valid when `train_from_scratch` is set to `true`).

max_training_dataset_size.description: Defines the maximum dataset size for training. If no value is provided, the whole dataset is used.

enable_hyper_parameter_optimization.description:
Boolean that indicates whether to run hyper-parameter optimization (HPO) before training.
This field is deprecated and should not be used, it will be removed in the future.

hpo_parameters.description: These parameters control the automatic hyper parameter optimization process, if it is enabled. If `enable_hyper_parameter_optimization` is set to `true`, the hpo_parameters in this field must be specified. Otherwise, this field can be left empty.

hpo_time_ratio.description: This parameter controls the time allotted for automatic hyper parameter optimization. It is measured in multiples of training time, e.g. setting `hpo_time_ratio` to `4.0` will result in the hpo process taking approximately 4 times as long as a normal training without hpo would.

model_purge_info.description:
Purging state of the model. A model is purged when all its binary files are removed from the server. 
This is performed through the [purge model](#Models/ArchiveModel) endpoint.

is_purged.description: Boolean indicating if the model is purged.

user_uid.description: The user ID who requested the cancellation.

purge_time.description: The time when the model was purged.

model_lifecycle_stage.description:
The current support status of the model format. 'Active' models are fully supported and maintained. 
'Obsolete' ones can be used for inference and deployment, but they can no longer be optimized.
In addition, training with an 'obsolete' happens from scratch rather than incrementally.

size.description: Model size in bytes.

total_disk_size.description:
The aggregated size (bytes) for model-related files. This includes all the exportable binaries, such as exportable code, 
and the binaries from the optimized models.

score.description: Accuracy score for the model. Only applicable for non-anomaly projects.

label_schema_in_sync.description: Boolean that indicates whether the label schema for the model is in sync with the latest label schema for the task containing the model

score_up_to_date.description:
Boolean indicating whether the score of the model is the most recent score.
This parameter is deprecated and should not be used, it will be removed in the future.

active_model.description: Boolean indicating that the model is used for inference requests for the project.

`fully_supervised` is for models that are trained through training job; while `one_shot` models are not. For example, `one_shot` 
is used for visual prompt models.

This is a 0-based index, meaning to retrieve the first frame of the video, this parameter should be set to `0`. 
The possible values for this parameter range from `0` to `frame_count-1`. The `frame_count` is the total number of frames contained in the video
and it can be retrieved from the response body of [video detail](#Media/GetVideoDetail) endpoint.

state.description: Overall state obtained aggregating the annotation states with the 'revisit' information on a per-task basis. This only has meaning for an  image/frame/scene, as a video does not have an annotation scene. - Image/VideoFrame/AnnotationScene: - to_revisit: Some annotations need to be revisited by the user for this task - annotated: All the ROIs for this task are annotated (contain a label for the task) - partially_annotated: Some ROIs for this task do not contain labels, other ones do - none: No label is present for this task - Video: - all tasks are set to null
