file.title: File
file.description: The dataset file to be uploaded.

import_to_project_existing_dataset.title: Import to project - existing dataset body

labels_map.title: Map of dataset label names to project label ids

import_to_project_new_dataset.title: Import to project - new dataset body

labels_map.title: Map of dataset label names to project label ids

file_id.description: The ID of the uploaded project archive zip file

project_name.description: The name to assign to the imported project

creator_id.description: Id of the user who started the deployment

creation_time.description: Creation time of the model

name.name: name
name.description: Fill this field to filter the list based on project name. This is an `include` filter.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: Number of items returned in the response. Default is 10 and maximum is 100.

skip.name: skip
skip.description:
Number indicating how many items to skip from the first item that matches the query. 
This field is used in combination with the limit field for the pagination feature.

sort_by.name: sort_by
sort_by.description: Field to sort by, could be name or creation_date

with_size.name: with_size
with_size.description: Set to true to return the project size in the response. Default is False.

include_deleted_labels.name: include_deleted_labels
include_deleted_labels.description: Set to True to also include the deleted labels in the response.  If set to true, each label will have a field called is_deleted that will be set to true if the label has been deleted. Default value is False.

dataset_id.name: dataset_id
dataset_id.description: The ID of the dataset in the project.

include_frame_details.name: include_frame_details
include_frame_details.description:
Set to true to include the frame details in the response. Note that this will increase the response size. 
Default is `false`.

frame_index.name: frame_index
frame_index.description:
This is a 0-based index, meaning to retrieve the first frame of the video, this parameter should be set to `0`. 
The possible values for this parameter range from `0` to `frame_count-1`. The `frame_count` is the total number of frames contained in the video
and it can be retrieved from the response body of [video detail](#Media/GetVideoDetail) endpoint.

annotation_id.name: annotation_id
annotation_id.description:
Set to `latest` to fetch the latest annotations. 
This parameter can also be set to the ID of a specific annotation. For example, the specific ID could be obtained 
from the [training revision](#Training%20dataset%20versions/GetMediaForDataset) response, 
where the response includes the specific user annotation for a media that is used for training.

label_only.name: label_only
label_only.description: Set to `true` to return the annotations without the geometric shapes. Default is `false`.

skip_frame.name: skip_frame
skip_frame.description: Number indicating for how many frames in the video an annotation should be uploaded. A value of 1 means every frame is annotated while a value of 10 means every 10th frame gets an annotation. If nothing is passed, it defaults to the video fps.

start_frame.name: start_frame
start_frame.description:
The starting index of the range of interest. This is a 0-based inclusive index, meaning to include the first frame of the video, 
this parameter should be set to `0`. The value cannot be bigger than `frame_count-1`. 
The `frame_count` is the total number of frames contained in the video
and it can be retrieved from the response body of [video detail](#Media/GetVideoDetail) endpoint.

end_frame.name: end_frame
end_frame.description: :- The ending index of the range of interest. This is a 0-based inclusive index, meaning to include the last frame of the video, this parameter should be set to `frame_count-1`; the value cannot be bigger than `frame_count-1`. The `frame_count` is the total number of frames contained in the video and it can be retrieved from the response body of [video detail](#Media/GetVideoDetail) endpoint.

frameskip.name: frameskip
frameskip.description:
Set to the number of desired frame intervals in the response. For example, to retrieve all frame annotations of the video, set this value to `1`. 
If not set, this value will be equal to the video fps. The video fps can be obtained from the response of the [video detail](#Media/GetVideoDetail) 
endpoint.

include_obsolete.name: include_obsolete
include_obsolete.description: Whether to include obsolete algorithms in the response.

model_group_id.name: model_group_id
model_group_id.description: The ID of the model group of interest. This can be found as `model_groups[].id` in the response body of [model group listing](#Models/GetModelGroups) endpoint.

model_id.name: model_id
model_id.description:
The ID of the model of interest. This can be found as `model_groups[].models[].id` from the response of [model group listing](#Models/GetModelGroups) 
endpoint or `models[].id` from [model group detail](#Models/GetModelGroup) endpoint.

optimized_model_id.name: optimized_model_id
optimized_model_id.description: The ID of the optimized model

model_only.name: model_only
model_only.description:
Only applicable to OpenVINO-optimized models. Set to `true` to only download the model binaries; set to `false` to also include
the code in the exported file.

pipeline_id_or_active.name: pipeline_id
pipeline_id_or_active.description:
Set this parameter to `active` request predictions generated using the currently active model(s) in the project.
For task chain, this parameter could be set to the task ID within the project to request for inference only for that task. 
The task ID can be found in the [project detail](#Projects/GetProjectInfo) endpoint.

roi.name: roi
roi.description:
The Region of Interest (ROI) of the image or video frame to use for inference.
The ROI is a rectangle defined by four zero-index pixel coordinates, separated by comma,
with the format: `left,top,width,height`.

use_cache.name: use_cache
use_cache.description:
This parameter defines the origin of the predictions.  

When `use_cache=always`, the predictions are pulled from the database cache. If no prediction with the desired configuration exists in the
cache, a 'not found' respones will be returned. 

When `use_cache=never`, the predictions are generated on the fly based on the request. Note that, the predictions are generated using
the OpenVINO model with FP32 precision with XAI. This model can be found under the [model detail](#Models/GetModelDetail) endpoint.  

When `use_cache=auto`, the system will first attempt to retrieve an existing prediction for the media item from the
cache. If no prediction with the desired configuration exists in the cache, a new prediction will be generated on the
fly. By default, `auto` is used.

task_id.name: task_id
task_id.description: The ID of the task of interest.

dataset_revision_id.name: dataset_revision_id
dataset_revision_id.description: The ID of the dataset of interest

model_test_id.name: test_id
model_test_id.description: The ID of the test of interest

filter_media_scores_sort_by.name: sort_by
filter_media_scores_sort_by.description: Field to sort by, only 'score' available

project_id-2.name: project_id
project_id-2.description: Select only items related to the given project.

job_state.name: state
job_state.description: Select only jobs in the given state.

job_type.name: job_type
job_type.description: Select only jobs of the given type.

author_id.name: author_id
author_id.description: Filter jobs by the author's unique identifier

start_time_from.name: start_time_from
start_time_from.description: Filter jobs which started after this time. If time is not specified (only date), it defaults to the beginning of the day.

start_time_to.name: start_time_to
start_time_to.description: Filter jobs which started before this time. If time is not specified (only date), it defaults to the beginning of the day.

jobs_sort_by.name: sort_by
jobs_sort_by.description: Field to sort by, could be [job_name, start_time, end_time, creation_date, priority]

job_id.name: job_id
job_id.description: The ID of the job of interest

model_id-2.name: model_id
model_id-2.description: The ID of the model of interest

algorithm_name.name: algorithm_name
algorithm_name.description: The name of the algorithm for which we want to pull the configurable parameters

file_id.name: file_id
file_id.description:
The ID of the file uploaded using the TUS protocol.
This can be found in the `Location` response header of [TUS upload initialization](#Project%20Import%2FExport/CreateTUSUpload).

file_id-2.name: file_id
file_id-2.description: The ID of the uploaded file

export_format.name: export_format
export_format.description: The format to which to export the dataset

include_unannotated_media.name: include_unannotated_media
include_unannotated_media.description: Boolean that indicates if unannotated media should be included in the export dataset.

save_video_as_images.name: save_video_as_images
save_video_as_images.description: If true, videos will be exported as a set of images, one for each annotated frame. If the specified dataset format cannot natively represent videos (e.g., VOC, COCO, ...), this parameter is overridden to true by the server. Conversely, if the format is Datumaro and this option is false, videos will be exported fully.

export_dataset_id.name: export_dataset_id
export_dataset_id.description: The ID of the export dataset of interest
